result.execSummary:
All charges against Howard Lee Goodman Jr in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Howard Lee Goodman Jr is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Howard Lee Goodman Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Howard Lee Goodman Jr in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Howard Lee Goodman Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Defendant Howard Lee Goodman Jr in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Howard Lee Goodman Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 10/26/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. Defendant's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. Defendant's Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine

Defendant Howard Lee Goodman Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Howard Lee Goodman Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-8-22

Defendant Howard Lee Goodman in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (6/17/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Danielle W.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Howard Lee Goodman in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 35 for a Pretrial Conference.
Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/15/22 @ 2:30p
